preprocess.tokenize

Class GeneralTokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • preprocess.tokenize.GeneralTokenizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tokenizer

    public class GeneralTokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tokenizer
    The Tokenizer iterates through a directory specified by a Path and returns all submissions Submission matching the SubmissionStructure.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      GeneralTokenizer(java.lang.String suffixRegexes, java.lang.String newArchiveRegexes)
      Instantiates a new Tokenizer.

      Iterates through a given Path with a specified SubmissionStructure to collect all submissions of students.
      java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getEmptySubmissions()
      This method is required by the Preprocessors to identify students that haven't submitted anything.

    • Method Detail

      • getEmptySubmissions

        public java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getEmptySubmissions()
        This method is required by the Preprocessors to identify students that haven't submitted anything.
        Specified by:
        getEmptySubmissions in interface Tokenizer
        Returns:
        a list of student that have not submitted anything

      • exploreSubmissionDirectory

        public java.util.List<Submission> exploreSubmissionDirectory(SubmissionStructure submissionStructure,
                                                    java.nio.file.Path location)
                                                      throws MaximumDirectoryDepthExceededException
        Description copied from interface: Tokenizer
        Iterates through a given Path with a specified SubmissionStructure to collect all submissions of students.
        Specified by:
        exploreSubmissionDirectory in interface Tokenizer
        Parameters:
        submissionStructure - A valid structure the location will be validated against.
        location - Where we search for files that belong to submissions
        Returns:
        For each detected Submission it returns a Submission object in a list. Returns empty list if exploration fails.
        Throws:
        MaximumDirectoryDepthExceededException - When the directory tree under scrutiny is deeper than maxDirectoryDepth (a constant defined in the sanitizer implementations), this exception is thrown in order to avoid a stack explosion.
